results.title: Coronavirus Live Updates: Americans Are on the Move, Even as New Warnings Sound
results.abstract: Millions more U.S. residents left their homes this week, according to a Times analysis. The stay-at-home order in L.A. could last into July. Dr. Anthony Fauci said reopening too soon risked a new runaway outbreak.

results.abstract: The downbeat assessment of Dr. Anthony S. Fauci and Dr. Robert R. Redfield contradicted President Trump’s growing insistence that the nation has put the coronavirus behind it.

results.title: Fearing a Second Wave, Cal State Will Keep Classes Online in the Fall
results.abstract: The move by the nation’s largest four-year public university system comes as many other schools insist they will find a way to bring students back to campus despite the coronavirus.

results.abstract: A study says the DART mission’s collision with an asteroid near Earth may liberate enough debris to reach Earth’s atmosphere.

results.title: How to Rethink Your Wedding
results.abstract: It can still be great. First, do not panic.

results.title: So You Had a Bad Day …
results.abstract: Here are some tips to pick yourself back up again, regain some dignity and soldier on after the lousiest of days.

results.title: How to Keep Children’s Stress From Turning Into Trauma
results.abstract: Parents can help children use the stress of coronavirus shutdowns as an opportunity for growth, experts say.

results.title: How to Grow a Victory Garden of Any Size
results.abstract: If it’s spring where you live, the time is now to start planning for your future fruits and vegetables.

results.title: Lost Your Job but Still Have a 401(k)? Here’s What to Do With It
results.abstract: Many newly unemployed Americans may have to dip into retirement funds to cover expenses. Even if you don’t, you have some decisions to make.

results.title: Eating in Xi’an, Where Wheat and Lamb Speak to China’s Varied Palate
results.abstract: In the city’s Muslim Quarter, meals are a celebration of globalization and ethnic diversity — and a lasting defense against erasure.

multimedia.caption: A dumpling steamer outside one of the shops in the Muslim district of Xi’an in central China, where locally cultivated wheat — once foreign to the country — is now crucial in the preparation of dumplings, noodles and bread.

results.title: How the Virus May Change Your Next Home
results.abstract: Designers and architects expect the pandemic to affect apartment design long after the lockdowns are over. Here are a few trends you’re likely to see.

multimedia.caption: Access to nature may become more of a priority: A rendering of Front & York, a new apartment complex by Morris Adjmi Architects, shows units wrapping around a 25,000-square-foot courtyard garden designed by Michael Van Valkenburgh Associates.

results.title: Jodeci’s Unplugged ‘Lately’ Was Its Pinnacle. Andre Harrell Made It Happen.
results.abstract: In 1993, the R&B group performed on an “MTV Unplugged” devoted to Harrell’s Uptown Records. “Lately” was a master class.

results.title: Fauci Doesn’t Want to Bring America Off the Bench, Trevor Noah Says
results.abstract: The “Daily Show” host likened reopening the country too soon to an athlete coming back early from an injury: “Now you’re just a gym teacher telling fifth-graders about how you could have gone pro.”

results.title: Children Gravely Ill With Covid-19 Often Had Other Medical Conditions
results.abstract: A study of 48 young I.C.U. patients in U.S. hospitals found that two died. Eighteen of the children were put on ventilators.
